Author: jorian#4555
Content: @xeonrider to stay with the cryptozombies, if i see that correctly, you program your own smart contract / dapp on an Ethereum sidechain. With komodo, you basically spawn your own independent blockchain (a new Ethereum if you like) after which you can start using assets as tokens, similar to ERC20 and ERC721

Author: jorian#4555
Content: it is similar, but at the same time you can't really compare ethereum and komodo

Author: jorian#4555
Content: you can build your own wallet perfectly fine

Author: jorian#4555
Content: and if you build komodo yourself, the `komodo-cli` is a wallet of some sorts, since you can create new addresses, send coins, etc

Author: xeonrider#3120
Content: the cli doesn't come with the binaries?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: they do

Author: jorian#4555
Content: there is komodod and there is komodo-cli

Author: jorian#4555
Content: komodo the daemon and komodo the command line interface

Author: xeonrider#3120
Content: alright, so how do I create my own wallet?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: you start the komodo blockchain, you use `komodo-cli getnewaddress` and ta-da, you have an address with 0 balance, in your wallet which is located at `~/.komodo/wallet.dat`

Author: polycryptoblog#1173
Content: https://github.com/KomodoPlatform/komodo/wiki/Installing-Komodo-Manually
